text.content:
Admission H&P 
 
CHIEF COMPLAINT: Fever of 103 at home, generalize lower back pain, hematuria, 
dysuria.
 
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: Pt. is a 55 year old FEMALE, veteran 
 That came to the ER this morning with the above complaints X 48 hours.  Prior 
to the onset of these symptoms she was feeling well.  She has had significant 
nausea and vomiting, but denies abdominal pain.  She has not been able to keep 
any food or liquid down today per her report.
 
PAST MEDICAL HISTORY:
Diabetes mellitus type 2
Hypertension
Osteopenia
Postoperative hypothyroidism
Depression
Hyperlipidemia
 
 
PAST SURGICAL HISTORY:
Thyroidectomy (complete, bilateral): 2002
 
 
WARNING: Connection to Remote Data Currently Down
 
Computer is the source for the following medication list:
 
==============
MEDICATIONS:
 
Active Inpatient and Outpatient Medications (including Supplies):
 
     Inpatient Medications                                  Status
=========================================================================
1)   AMPICILLIN/SULBACTAM INJ AMPICILLIN/SULBACTAM 1.5 GM   ACTIVE
       in DEXTROSE 5% IN WATER 50 ML  INFUSE OVER 15
       MINUTES IVP Q6H
2)   ASPIRIN TAB,EC  81MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
3)   CALCIUM CARBONATE TAB  500 MG PO TID                   ACTIVE
4)   CHLORTHALIDONE TAB  12.5 MG PO QDAY                    ACTIVE
5)   DEXT 5% NACL 0.9% INJ,SOLN in DEXTROSE 5%/0.9% SOD     ACTIVE
       CHLORIDE 1000 ML  75 ml/hr IV
6)   ERGOCALCIFEROL CAP,ORAL  1000 UNITS PO QDAY            ACTIVE
7)   GLYBURIDE TAB  2.5MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
8)   LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) TAB  0.125MG PO QDAY      ACTIVE
9)   LISINOPRIL TAB  20MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
10)  SIMVASTATIN TAB  80MG PO QPM                           ACTIVE
11)  VENLAFAXINE TAB  75MG PO BID                           ACTIVE
 
     Outpatient Medications                                 Status
=========================================================================
1)   ASPIRIN 81MG EC TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
2)   CALCIUM CARBONATE 1.25GM (CA 500MG) TAB TAKE 500 MG    ACTIVE
       BY MOUTH THREE TIMES A DAY
3)   CHLORTHALIDONE 25MG TAB TAKE 12.5 MG  BY MOUTH DAILY   ACTIVE
4)   ERGOCALCIFEROL 1000 UNIT CAP TAKE 1000 UNITS BY MOUTH  ACTIVE
       DAILY
5)   GLYBURIDE 2.5MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
6)   LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) 0.125MG TAB TAKE ONE      ACTIVE
       TABLET BY MOUTH DAILY
7)   LISINOPRIL 20MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH DAILY     ACTIVE
8)   SIMVASTATIN 80MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY    ACTIVE
       EVENING
9)   VENLAFAXINE HCL 37.5MG TAB TAKE TWO TABLETS BY MOUTH   ACTIVE
       TWICE A DAY
 
20 Total Medications
 
ALLERGIES/ADRS:
METFORMIN, CITALOPRAM, FLUOXETINE
 
  ==============================================================
  MEDICATION RECONCILIATION: 
  I have reviewed the patient's outpatient medications with the patient or
  caregiver.
  The above list accurately reflects the medications the patient is
  currently taking.  This medication profile was reviewed and considered
  when placing inpatient orders for this hospital admission.
  ==============================================================
 
  SOCIAL HISTORY: 
    Living Situation: Divorced, lives with 2 kids at home
 
  Tobacco use: Quit approx 2002
    Tobacco products patient uses:
      Cigarettes 1/2 p/day x 20 years
 
  ETOH:
    Yes, but rarely
 
  Drugs:
    No.
 
  Marital Status: Divorced
 
FAMILY HISTORY:
 Diabetes mellitus type 2 and osteoporosis in the patients mother.
 
 
REVIEW OF SYSTEMS:
  GENERAL: she has had fever and chills x 48 hours; denies recent weight change
  SKIN: no rashes
  HEENT: no vision changes, no stiff neck
  CARDIAC: denies chest pain
  PULMONARY: no dyspnea, no cough
  GI: She has had n/v but denies d/c
  GU: She has had hematuria and pain on urination
  EXTREMITY/MUSCULOSKELETAL: no LE swelling
  NEUROLOGIC: no weakness
 
 WANDERING RISK ASSESSMENT (VA Directive 2010-052)
     Patient is NOT cognitively impaired.
 
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION:
VITAL SIGNS:
            B/P:  132/70 (05/30/2012 17:53)
          Pulse:  112 (05/30/2012 17:53)
    Temperature:  103.4 F [39.7 C] (05/30/2012 17:53)
   Respirations:  14 (05/30/2012 17:53)
  P02%: 93
         Weight:  241 lb [109.5 kg] (05/30/2012 13:30)
         Height:  64 in [162.6 cm] (07/20/2010 14:00)
            BMI:  41
           Pain:  3 (05/30/2012 17:53)
 
GEN: NAD, mildly ill appearing 
HEENT: NCAT, EOMI, PERRLA, TMs pearly gray with normal landmarks, throat non-
erythematous with no exudates, nasal turbinates clear and pink.
NECK: no lymphadenopathy
HEART: RRR no M/R/G
LUNGS: CTAB no W/R/R
ABD: Soft; mildly tender in lower, mid abd; ND; no rebound tenderness.
BACK: mild-moderate CVA tenderness, especially on the R.
EXT: no LE swelling or erythema
 
 
LABS: 
05/30/12  13:30    GLUCOSE              160H
05/30/12  13:30    UREA NITROGEN        36H
05/30/12  13:30    CREATININE           1.5H
05/30/12  13:30    SODIUM               138
05/30/12  13:30    POTASSIUM            4.2
05/30/12  13:30    CHLORIDE             106
05/30/12  13:30    CO2                  31
05/30/12  13:30    WBC                  8.6H
05/30/12  13:30    RBC                  4.2
05/30/12  13:30   HGB                  14.2
05/30/12  13:30    HCT                  42.3
 
05/30/12  13:30    MCV                  84.2
05/30/12  13:30    MCH                  28.2
05/30/12  13:30    MCHC                 34.6
05/30/12  13:30    RDW                  13
05/30/12  13:30    PLATELET COUNT       142
05/30/12  13:30    MPV                  7.5
05/30/12  13:30    BASOPHIL %           1
05/30/12  13:30    LYMPH %              15L
05/30/12  13:30    NEUTROPHIL %         83
05/30/12  13:30    MONOCYTE %           1L
05/30/12  13:30    EOSIN %              1
 
Labs/Studies:
        UA: consistent with UTI - +RBC, +Bact, +LE, +Nit 
        Urine Culture: pending
        Blood Culture: pending
 
ASSESSMENT/PLAN: 
1.      Likely pyelonephritis: Unasyn 1.5 gm IV X 1 given in ED.  1L NS 
bolus given in ED.  Labs c/w pyelo and dehydration.  Admit to medicine service 
for further treatment. 
EXPECTED LENGTH OF STAY is 2 days.
